summary: An Ordinance repealing Ordinance No. 12329, entitled "An Ordinance providing for the improvement of King Street, from Twentieth Avenue South to Twenty-first Avenue South; Twenty-first Avenue South, from King Street to Norman Street; Weller Street, from Twenty-first Avenue South to Twentieth Avenue South; Lane Street, from Twenty-first Avenue South to Twentieth Avenue South; and Norman Street, from Twenty-first Avenue South to Twenty-second Avenue South, all in the City of Seattle, by constructing therein sewers of proper dimensions together with all necessary appurtenances, in accordance with Resolution of the City Council of the City of Seattle, No. 453, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by an act of the Legislature of the State of Washington, entitled "An act authorizing the issuance and sale of bonds by cities, to pay for local improvements, providing for the payment thereof, and declaring an emergency, approved March 14, 1899, and Ordinance No. 5693 of said city, approved December 6, 1899."
